newsitem.title: GERMANY: German labour office sees 1998 jobless over 4 mln.
newsitem.headline: German labour office sees 1998 jobless over 4 mln.

text.p: Germany expects average joblessness to fall about 200,000 in 1998 from this year's average, but to remain above four million, Federal Labour Office vice president Klaus Leven told Reuters Financial Television.
"I am hoping, not predicting, hoping for a decrease of about 200,000 in average jobless for next year, which still leaves us with a figure above four million," Leven said.
Leven also said it was too soon to expect a real cut in spending on unemployment benefits.
This year, unemployment is expected to average a postwar record 4.2 million to 4.3 million, up from 3.9 million in 1996.
